text: [Music]
hi I am Niharika and welcome back to a
new lesson remember we did a lesson on
horse idioms that today I have a lesson
for you with dog idioms me being a dog
lover and of course dogs known for their
loyalty have also influenced the English
language to a great extent so some of
these expressions would help you to talk
in a very confident manner so let's have
a look the first one that I have for you
is every dog has its day by implication
every person has its day so what exactly
it means well maybe you are going
through a very bad time for weeks you
have been really upset or been very
stressed about something but don't worry
there would be a period of power or
influence there will be a day when luck
and success will be in your favor cell
which means that do not be upset every
dog has its day for example you will be
selected for the football team I'm sure
about that because every dog has its day
let's have a look at the other one over
here dog with two tails now this means
someone who is extremely happy now when
you meet someone who is extremely happy
you can use this expression well you
look like a dog with two tails well it
comes from this phrase originally comes
from the fact that you know how dogs are
really happy to see someone or to see
their owner and they start bagging their
tails really fast well that's what it is
when they wag their tail very fast it
just gives an image of two tails so
that's where this expression comes from
a dog with two tails
which means you are extremely happy
let's have a look at another one here an
old dog will learn no tricks which means
a person was growing old it's difficult
to change their mindset or change their
traits or their habits you know if
someone is doing something in a certain
way it's probably impossible to change
that way right for example my uncle is
way too adamant but of course he's 69
and an old dog will learn no tricks so
which means it's very difficult to teach
or change someone's attitude or their
way or their mindset or habits okay the
next one that I have for you is let
sleeping dogs lie
lets sleeping dogs lie what do you think
this means well it means let go things
you know do not say something that would
aggravate a situation don't bring in
your past for example you bump into your
ex-girlfriend and probably you had
cheated on her and you bump into her in
a mall maybe you want to justify maybe
you really want to explain why and how
you cheated on her but then I would
suggest let sleeping dogs lie so just
avoid that situation that would you know
disturb it or complicate it further so
which means just let go let sleeping
dogs lie the next one that I have for
you over here is sick as a dog as sick
as a dog means very ill now if you're
really ill okay maybe you're throwing up
and your stomach is hurting maybe you're
passing motions this means you are sick
as a dog especially with stomach malady
so maybe you ate some
thing which is giving you bad cramps and
you were throwing up so you can say oh
my god I am as sick as a dog so this
means you are very ill so for example I
have been as sick as a dog since the
time I have eaten those sausage rolls so
maybe those sausage rolls did not suit
your tummy and now you are really ill
the next one that I have for you is
dirty dog now what is dirty dog you
might have heard people saying you are a
dirty dog what does that mean well it
means that a person who cannot be
trusted okay someone that you really
cannot rely upon so you know some people
who really act cheap and they like
cheating on people so this means they're
dirty dogs so you can say maybe you guys
are playing poker and a friend of yours
cheated and one lot of money you would
say he's a dirty dog so the way he
played poker and won the money
he basically cheated okay it was not a
fair game so you can always use this
expression so these are these six
expressions that you can use in your
daily conversations I'll be back with a
new lesson for you
till then you take care and have a great
day
you
